Posts.EditableText:
Hi guys

First of all, I just wanted to say that I really like Quest and it has inspired me to create something completely from scratch.  I do not know if this is appropriate or not, but I wanted to tell you about the software I am busy creating with which you can create online interface fiction, just like with Quest.

Please don't get me wrong, I really really liked Quest, but there were something I wanted to do that I could not find in Quest.

The editor is still far from completed.  It is only in alpha (main features complete, but still buggy).  If any of you guys ever wanted to see what it looks like, head over to [url:lm5q7z7z]http://www.sillygamesstudio.com[/url:lm5q7z7z].  It is an online editor, currently with now server-side saving or processing.  The entire editor with built-in player runs on the client (browser).  If you create a new story, you can download it to your local machine, and also upload it again to modify/play it.

I plan on adding server-side saving as well as full publishing of your end product as a complete, stand-alone, publishable web site.

Anyways... Just wanted to show it to you and perhaps get some critique... 

Kind regards,

Bridgette

I like it.  It has a smooth feeling when using it because it's fast and minimalist.  No login required and the download feature is nice.

Not working on mobiles and create some things that doesn't show.  I think scripts are limited from the setup game, no multimedia scripts.

I'll be open to translate it to spanish when it's finished if you create a language option.  It will be well received in the spanish community.

Good to go!
